info.title: Mailchimp Marketing API
info.description:
The Mailchimp Marketing API provides programmatic access to Mailchimp data and functionality, allowing developers to build custom integrations. This API enables management of audiences, campaigns, automations, reports, e-commerce data, and more.

Capabilities include:
- Audience management - Create and manage lists, members, segments, and tags
- Campaign management - Create, send, and analyze email campaigns
- Automation - Build and manage automated email workflows
- E-commerce - Track revenue, products, and customer purchase history
- Reports - Access detailed analytics and performance metrics
- Landing pages - Create and publish lead generation pages
- Webhooks - Receive real-time notifications of account activity

dc.description: The data center prefix for your Mailchimp account. Obtain this from the OAuth metadata endpoint (https://login.mailchimp.com/oauth2/metadata) after authentication.

tags.name: Root
tags.description: API root resource with account information and links to all other resources

tags.name: Lists
tags.description: Manage audiences (lists) - the foundation of contact management in Mailchimp

tags.name: Members
tags.description: Manage list members (contacts) including subscribed, unsubscribed, and bounced

tags.name: Segments
tags.description: Create and manage segments to filter and target specific groups of contacts

tags.name: Tags
tags.description: Organize contacts with tags for better targeting and organization

tags.name: Merge Fields
tags.description: Manage custom fields for storing additional contact information

tags.name: Campaigns
tags.description: Create, send, and manage email marketing campaigns

tags.name: Reports
tags.description: Access campaign analytics, performance metrics, and subscriber activity

tags.name: Automations
tags.description: Build and manage automated email workflows triggered by events or schedules

tags.name: E-commerce
tags.description: Track stores, products, orders, and customer purchase history for revenue analytics

tags.name: Connected Sites
tags.description: Manage website connections for tracking and pop-up forms

tags.name: Facebook Ads
tags.description: Create and manage Facebook ad campaigns for social retargeting

tags.name: Landing Pages
tags.description: Create and publish landing pages for lead generation

tags.name: Batch Webhooks
tags.description: Configure webhooks for batch operation notifications

tags.name: Conversations
tags.description: View and manage subscriber replies to campaigns

tags.name: Account Exports
tags.description: Export account data for analysis and backup

tags.name: Campaign Folders
tags.description: Organize campaigns into folders

tags.name: Template Folders
tags.description: Organize templates into folders

tags.name: Search
tags.description: Search campaigns and members across your account

tags.name: Verified Domains
tags.description: Manage verified sending domains for improved deliverability

tags.name: List Webhooks
tags.description: Configure webhooks for list-level event notifications

get.description: Get links to all other resources available in the API, plus account information.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference sub-objects with dot notation.

get.description: Get information about all lists (audiences) in the account.

parameters.name: before_date_created
parameters.description: Restrict response to lists created before the set date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: since_date_created
parameters.description: Restrict response to lists created after the set date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: before_campaign_last_sent
parameters.description: Restrict response to lists with a campaign sent before the set date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: since_campaign_last_sent
parameters.description: Restrict response to lists with a campaign sent after the set date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Restrict response to lists that include a specific subscriber's email address.

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Sort field for results.

parameters.name: sort_dir
parameters.description: Sort direction for results.

parameters.name: has_ecommerce_store
parameters.description: Restrict response to lists with an e-commerce store.

parameters.name: include_total_contacts
parameters.description: Include total contact counts in response.

post.description: Create a new list (audience) in your Mailchimp account.

get.description: Get information about a specific list (audience).

parameters.name: include_total_contacts
parameters.description: Include total contact counts in response.

patch.description: Update the settings for a specific list (audience).

delete.description: Delete a list (audience) from your Mailchimp account. This is a permanent action.

get.description: Get information about members in a specific list (audience).

parameters.name: email_type
parameters.description: Filter by email type (html or text).

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by subscription status.

parameters.name: since_timestamp_opt
parameters.description: Filter by opt-in time after this date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: before_timestamp_opt
parameters.description: Filter by opt-in time before this date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: since_last_changed
parameters.description: Filter by last changed date after this date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: before_last_changed
parameters.description: Filter by last changed date before this date (ISO 8601 format).

parameters.name: unique_email_id
parameters.description: Filter by unique email ID.

parameters.name: vip_only
parameters.description: Filter to return only VIP members.

parameters.name: interest_category_id
parameters.description: Filter by interest category ID.

parameters.name: interest_ids
parameters.description: Filter by comma-separated interest IDs.

parameters.name: interest_match
parameters.description: How to match interest IDs (any or all).

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Sort field.

parameters.name: sort_dir
parameters.description: Sort direction.

parameters.name: since_last_campaign
parameters.description: Filter for members who have or haven't engaged since last campaign.

parameters.name: unsubscribed_since
parameters.description: Filter for unsubscribed members since this date (ISO 8601 format).

post.description: Add a new member to the list (audience).

parameters.name: skip_merge_validation
parameters.description: If true, skip merge field validation.

get.description: Get information about a specific list member.

put.description: Add or update a list member. If the member exists, update them; otherwise, add them.

parameters.name: skip_merge_validation
parameters.description: If true, skip merge field validation.

patch.description: Update information for a specific list member.

parameters.name: skip_merge_validation
parameters.description: If true, skip merge field validation.

delete.description: Archive a list member (soft delete). Use the permanent delete action for GDPR compliance.

post.description: Permanently delete a list member. This action is GDPR compliant and cannot be undone.

get.description: Get the tags on a list member.

post.description: Add or remove tags from a list member. Use status 'active' to add or 'inactive' to remove.

get.description: Get information about all available segments for a specific list.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by segment type.

parameters.name: since_created_at
parameters.description: Filter segments created after this date (ISO 8601).

parameters.name: before_created_at
parameters.description: Filter segments created before this date (ISO 8601).

parameters.name: include_cleaned
parameters.description: Include cleaned members in count.

parameters.name: include_transactional
parameters.description: Include transactional members in count.

parameters.name: include_unsubscribed
parameters.description: Include unsubscribed members in count.

parameters.name: since_updated_at
parameters.description: Filter segments updated after this date (ISO 8601).

parameters.name: before_updated_at
parameters.description: Filter segments updated before this date (ISO 8601).

post.description: Create a new segment in a specific list.

get.description: Get information about a specific segment.

parameters.name: include_cleaned
parameters.description: Include cleaned members in count.

parameters.name: include_transactional
parameters.description: Include transactional members in count.

parameters.name: include_unsubscribed
parameters.description: Include unsubscribed members in count.

patch.description: Update a specific segment in a list.

delete.description: Delete a specific segment in a list.

get.description: Get the merge fields for a list.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Filter by merge field type.

parameters.name: required
parameters.description: Filter by required status.

post.description: Add a new merge field for a list.

get.description: Get information about all webhooks for a specific list.

post.description: Create a new webhook for a specific list.

mailchimp_oauth.description: OAuth 2.0 authentication for accessing Mailchimp data on behalf of users. Access tokens do not expire. After obtaining the token, retrieve the user's data center prefix from the metadata endpoint (https://login.mailchimp.com/oauth2/metadata).

fields.name: fields
fields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference sub-objects with dot notation.

excludeFields.name: exclude_fields
excludeFields.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference sub-objects with dot notation.

count.name: count
count.description: The number of records to return. Default is 10, maximum is 1000.

offset.name: offset
offset.description: The number of records to skip for pagination. Default is 0.

listId.name: list_id
listId.description: The unique ID for the list (audience).

subscriberHash.name: subscriber_hash
subscriberHash.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase email address or the email ID.

segmentId.name: segment_id
segmentId.description: The unique ID for the segment.

campaignId.name: campaign_id
campaignId.description: The unique ID for the campaign.

storeId.name: store_id
storeId.description: The unique ID for the store.

workflowId.name: workflow_id
workflowId.description: The unique ID for the automation workflow.

connectedSiteId.name: connected_site_id
connectedSiteId.description: The unique ID for the connected site.

outreachId.name: outreach_id
outreachId.description: The unique ID for the outreach (Facebook ad).

pageId.name: page_id
pageId.description: The unique ID for the landing page.

batchWebhookId.name: batch_webhook_id
batchWebhookId.description: The unique ID for the batch webhook.

conversationId.name: conversation_id
conversationId.description: The unique ID for the conversation.

exportId.name: export_id
exportId.description: The unique ID for the account export.

folderId.name: folder_id
folderId.description: The unique ID for the folder.

Error.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API

ProblemDetail.description: An error generated by the Mailchimp API. Conforms to IETF RFC 7807.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type.

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.
detail.example: The requested resource could not be found.

instance.description: A string that identifies this specific occurrence of the problem.

ResourceLink.description: A link to another resource or action.

href.description: The URL to the linked resource.

method.description: The HTTP method for the link.

APIRoot.description: The API root resource with account information and links.

login_id.description: The ID associated with the user who owns this API key.

first_name.description: The first name tied to the account.

last_name.description: The last name tied to the account.

username.description: The username tied to the account.

avatar_url.description: URL of the avatar for the user.

role.description: The user role for the account.

member_since.description: The date and time the account was created (ISO 8601).

first_payment.description: Date of first payment for monthly plans.

account_industry.description: The industry associated with the account.

last_login.description: The date and time of the last login.

total_subscribers.description: Total number of subscribers across all lists.

IndustryStats.description: Average campaign statistics for the account's industry.

id.description: The unique ID for the list.

web_id.description: The ID used in web URLs.

permission_reminder.description: The permission reminder for the list.

date_created.description: The date and time the list was created.

email_type_option.description: Whether list supports multiple email formats.

beamer_address.description: Email address for posting to list.

visibility.description: Whether list is public or private.

CampaignDefaults.description: Default values for campaigns using this list.

CreateListRequest.description: Request to create a new list.

email_type_option.description: Whether to allow multiple email formats.
Whether to allow multiple email formats.

id.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase email address.

email_type.description: Type of email the member prefers.

consents_to_one_to_one_messaging.description: Whether member consents to one-to-one messaging.

ip_signup.description: IP address where the member signed up.

ip_opt.description: IP address where member confirmed opt-in.

last_changed.description: Date and time of last change.

AddMemberRequest.description: Request to add a member to a list.

ip_signup.description: IP address where member signed up.

ip_opt.description: IP address where member confirmed opt-in.

tags.description: Tags to add to the member.

MemberTagsRequest.description: Request to add or remove tags.

status.description: Tag status (active to add, inactive to remove).

is_syncing.description: Whether this is a sync operation.

static_segment.description: Email addresses for a static segment.

CreateMergeFieldRequest.description: Request to create a merge field.

schedule_time.description: The date and time to send (ISO 8601).

SendTestEmailRequest.description: Request to send a test email.

test_emails.description: Email addresses to send test to.

AutomationEmail.description: An email in an automation workflow.

list_id.description: The list ID to connect the store to.

CreateConnectedSiteRequest.description: Request to create a connected site.

CreateLandingPageRequest.description: Request to create a landing page.

UpdateLandingPageRequest.description: Request to update a landing page.

CreateBatchWebhookRequest.description: Request to create a batch webhook.

UpdateBatchWebhookRequest.description: Request to update a batch webhook.

CreateAccountExportRequest.description: Request to create an account export.

CreateVerifiedDomainRequest.description: Request to add a verified domain.
